text: Veranus Alva Moore (April 13, 1859 - February 11, 1931) was a U.S. bacteriologist and pathologist. He was born in Hounsfield, New York. A Cornell University graduate and faculty member, Moore served as second dean of the Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine from 1908 to 1929. ==References== Category:1859 births Category:1931 deaths Category:American pathologists Category:Cornell University alumni Category:Cornell University faculty Category:People from Hounsfield, New York Category:Scientists from New York (state)
title: Veranus Alva Moore
